posts.post_content:
People vastly overestimate this card...  
  
You're playing a goblin deck, you run into a thopter deck. Oops.  
  
You're playing a thopter deck, you run into a saproling deck. Oops.  
  
You're playing any of the above. You run into a [Peacekeeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Peacekeeper) and lose because you banked everything on attacking.
posts.html:

You're playing any of the above. You run into a Peacekeeper and lose because you banked everything on attacking.

posts.post_content:
Yeah, the one you're talking about is [Sliver Legion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sliver Legion), Karthwine. It's much harder to cast and your opponent will find more ways for removal, yet since it's a Sliver-exclusive Coat of Arms it would have suited nicer into the deck kind of.  
Yet since the deck already had [Sliver Overlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sliver Overlord) taking the Mythic Rare slot that didn't work out.

posts.post_content: if i was to play this but had a [Eladamri, Lord of Leaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eladamri, Lord of Leaves )  in play or bring 1 into play afterwards. would the effect of coat of arms be canceled by the shroud the elves would have? is the effect of a coat of arms considered an ability?
posts.html:
if i was to play this but had a Eladamri, Lord of Leaves in play or bring 1 into play afterwards. would the effect of coat of arms be canceled by the shroud the elves would have? is the effect of a coat of arms considered an ability?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: LeMaK (12/3/2009 1:18:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ LeMaK
  
   
Coat of Arms has a static ability. But the ability doesn't target your creatures individually. So [Eladamri, Lord of Leaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eladamri, Lord of Leaves) does not stop Coat of Arms from working on your creatures.
posts.html:
@ LeMaK

Coat of Arms has a static ability. But the ability doesn't target your creatures individually. So Eladamri, Lord of Leaves does not stop Coat of Arms from working on your creatures.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Eved (12/18/2009 3:24:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
An extremely valuable card for creature-specialised decks that summons alot of creatures or tokens sharing the same creature type ([martial coup](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=martial coup) or [conqueror's pledge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=conqueror's pledge)).. The only bad thing is that it also buffs your opponent's creatures as well  
  
With martial coup (X mana paid: 5)= five 6/6 soldiers= 30 combat damage  
With conqueror's pledge (not kicked)= six 7/7 soldiers= 42 combat damage  
With conqueror's pledge (kicked)=twelve 13/13 solders!!= 156 combat damage (Costs 18 mana)
posts.html:

With conqueror's pledge (not kicked)= six 7/7 soldiers= 42 combat damage
With conqueror's pledge (kicked)=twelve 13/13 solders!!= 156 combat damage (Costs 18 mana)

Posted By: Norro (2/25/2010 9:11:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@TheRebel:   
"Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares **at least one** creature type with it."  
So the changelings would only get +1/+1 from each other, since they have at least one creature type in common.   
  
The cruelest deck you could run this card in would be a Changeling deck, followed by Slivers.
posts.html:
@TheRebel:
"Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it."
So the changelings would only get +1/+1 from each other, since they have at least one creature type in common.

The cruelest deck you could run this card in would be a Changeling deck, followed by Slivers.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Diachronos (3/21/2010 7:13:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Works really well with [Nacatl War-Pride](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nacatl War-Pride) and a [Gruul War Plow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gruul War Plow). It actually becomes preferable if your opponent has lots of creatures in play, because you will always have 1 more Cat and they have Trample. Normally, having an opponent with 17 or more creatures in play is terrible, but this combo means that you are likely to hit them for 20 in one go.
posts.html:
Works really well with Nacatl War-Pride and a Gruul War Plow. It actually becomes preferable if your opponent has lots of creatures in play, because you will always have 1 more Cat and they have Trample. Normally, having an opponent with 17 or more creatures in play is terrible, but this combo means that you are likely to hit them for 20 in one go.
